net.objectzoo.delegates.adapters

Class Function0ToFunction0Async<R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.objectzoo.delegates.adapters.Function0ToFunction0Async<R>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - The type of the Func0's return value
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Function0Async<R>

    public class Function0ToFunction0Async<R>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Function0Async<R>
    An adapter that converts a conventional Function0 or Supplier to an Function0Async.

    All asynchronous calls are executed in another thread and forwarded to the Function0.get() method.

    The Executor to use for the asynchronous invocations can be chosen during creation of this adapter. If no explicit executor is given the a default executor is used. The default executor can be set using the AsyncExecutor.setDefaultExecutor(Executor) property or is created automatically by the AsyncExecutor.

    Author:
    tilmann

    • Method Detail

      • beginGet

        public FunctionAsyncResult<R> beginGet(java.util.function.Consumer<? super FunctionAsyncResult<R>> callback,
                                       java.lang.Object asyncState)
        Asynchronously invoke this Function0Async with the given parameter value, callback and asyncState.

        Associated with each call to beginInvoke is a FunctionAsyncResult instance returned by the call and given to the callback that can be used to track the status and outcome of the invocation.

        Specified by:
        beginGet in interface Function0Async<R>
        Parameters:
        callback - the Consumer, if given to beginInvoke, is invoked upon completion of the Function0Async's invocation and receives the same FunctionAsyncResult that is returned by the call to beginInvoke.
        asyncState - the asyncState is an arbitrary reference that, if given to beginInvoke, can be retrieved from this invocations FunctionAsyncResult.getAsyncState()
        Returns:
        the FunctionAsyncResult associated with this asynchronous invocation
